status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
We are seeing issue to install arrow R package on RHEL machines. Using below command to install arrow.
*R -e "install.packages(\"remotes\",repos = \"http://cran.r-project.org\");remotes::install_github(\"apache/arrow\", subdir = \"r\", ref = \"apache-arrow-0.14.1\")"*


*Error logs :*

The downloaded source packages are in
	'/tmp/Rtmpycmy4e/downloaded_packages'
[0m[91mUpdating HTML index of packages in '.Library'
[0m[91mMaking 'packages.html' ...[0m[91m done
[0m[91mRunning `R CMD build`...
[0m* checking for file '/tmp/Rtmpycmy4e/remotesa23015b2/apache-arrow-8d09de2/r/DESCRIPTION' ... OK
* preparing 'arrow':
* checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ... OK
* cleaning src
* running 'cleanup'
* checking for LF line-endings in source and make files and shell scripts
* checking for empty or unneeded directories
* building 'arrow_0.14.1.tar.gz'
[91m* installing *source* package 'arrow' ...
[0m[91m** using staged installation
[0m$ pkg-config --cflags --silence-errors arrow parquet
PKGCONFIG_CFLAGS = "-DNDEBUG  "
$ pkg-config --libs arrow parquet
PKGCONFIG_LIBS = "-lparquet -larrow  "

Found pkg-config cflags and libs!
PKG_CFLAGS=-DNDEBUG   -DARROW_R_WITH_ARROW
PKG_LIBS=-lparquet -larrow  
[91m** libs
[0mg++ -std=gnu++11 -I"/opt/ibm/conda/R/lib64/R/include" -DNDEBUG -DNDEBUG   -DARROW_R_WITH_ARROW -I"/opt/ibm/conda/R/lib64/R/library/Rcpp/include" -I/usr/local/include -fvisibility=hidden -fpic  -g -O2  -c array.cpp -o array.o
[91mIn file included from /opt/ibm/conda/R/lib64/R/library/Rcpp/include/Rcpp/macros/macros.h:134:0,
                 from /opt/ibm/conda/R/lib64/R/library/Rcpp/include/Rcpp/r/headers.h:69,
                 from /opt/ibm/conda/R/lib64/R/library/Rcpp/include/RcppCommon.h:29,
                 from ./arrow_types.h:24,
                 from array.cpp:18:
./arrow_types.h:188:26: error: 'Type' is not a member of 'arrow::ipc::Message'
 RCPP_EXPOSED_ENUM_NODECL(arrow::ipc::Message::Type)
                          ^
/opt/ibm/conda/R/lib64/R/library/Rcpp/include/Rcpp/macros/module.h:76:106: note: in definition of macro 'RCPP_EXPOSED_ENUM_AS'

 ^
[0m[91mIn file included from array.cpp:18:0:
array.cpp: In function 'arrow::ArrayVector StructArray__Flatten(const std::shared_ptr<arrow::StructArray>&)':
array.cpp:139:67: error: no matching function for call to 'arrow::StructArray::Flatten(arrow::MemoryPool*, arrow::ArrayVector*)'

array.cpp:139:3: note: in expansion of macro 'STOP_IF_NOT_OK'
   STOP_IF_NOT_OK(array->Flatten(arrow::default_memory_pool(), &out));

In file included from /usr/include/arrow/array.h:29:0,
                 from /usr/include/arrow/api.h:22,

Execution halted

comments.body:
It seems like you have installed Arrow C++ already in your system. Thus please answer the following questions:

 
 * Which version of Arrow C++ is installed on your system?
 * Why are you trying to install 0.14.1 and not a later release?

[~uwe] Our consumer is still using 0.14.1 in old release of our product so we can not upgrade to latest one in old release.

*Below version of C++ we are using :*

--> Running transaction check
---> Package arrow-devel.x86_64 0:1.0.1-1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: arrow-libs = 1.0.1-1.el7 for package: arrow-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libarrow.so.100()(64bit) for package: arrow-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
---> Package arrow-glib-devel.x86_64 0:1.0.1-1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: gobject-introspection-devel for package: arrow-glib-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libarrow-glib.so.100()(64bit) for package: arrow-glib-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
---> Package parquet-devel.x86_64 0:1.0.1-1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: parquet-libs = 1.0.1-1.el7 for package: parquet-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libparquet.so.100()(64bit) for package: parquet-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
---> Package parquet-glib-devel.x86_64 0:1.0.1-1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libparquet-glib.so.100()(64bit) for package: parquet-glib-devel-1.0.1-1.el7.x86_64
--> Running transaction check
---> Package arrow-glib-libs.x86_64 0:1.0.1-1.el7 will be installed
---> Package arrow-libs.x86_64 0:1.0.1-1.el7 will be installed

You'll need to either install the arrow-devel system packages at the same 0.14.1 version; or checkout apache/arrow at apache-arrow-0.14.1, build the C++ library from source (following the documentation included at that tag), then install the R package from that checkout.

There is much better support for installing the R package on Linux in more recent {{arrow}} releases, but unfortunately that can't be easily backported to 0.14.1.
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
